nodes.bodyText: Just out of curiosity, why changing the scope? Is this because it's meant to be only used within a server?
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -29,6 +29,7 @@
     <dependency>
       <groupId>org.apache.kafka</groupId>
       <artifactId>kafka-clients</artifactId>
+      <scope>provided</scope>

nodes.bodyText: Probably not required, but maybe it's worth checking - clear method in this class, shouldn't also be clearing rest of the member such as signals, signalsMetadata and messages (just for consistency)?

It's a little ambiguous here - id and name are both the same, so maybe it's worth saying @return name of the signals defined in the process (just avoid confusion)

  
    
      
        Suggested change
        
          
    

        
      
    
    
      
          
            
                 * Returns process definition signals names.
          
          
            
                 * @return id of the signals defined in the process
          
          
            
                 * Returns process definition signals names.
          
          
            
                 * @return names of the signals defined in the process
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -90,11 +91,17 @@
     Collection<String> getReusableSubProcesses();
 
     /**
-     * Returns process definition signals.
-     * @return signals
+     * Returns process definition signals names.
+     * @return id of the signals defined in the process

nodes.bodyText: Maybe it's worth checking if signal is not null to avoid any potential NPE - wdyt?
same as above
I like pepe :) but I'd change to something more meaningful so it's easier and quicker to understand what these arguments are meant for at first sight.
sorry for asking but I can't see any potential backward compatibility issue here, do you mind clarifying? thanks!

[JBPM-9436] AMQ Streams (Kafka) listener functionality / consumer

nodes.bodyText:
Any time you create a signal in the bpmn2 modeler should create a signal element. So this should not be needed.
This is actually hiding a problem in the bpmn2 modeler IMO if that is happening.
There are few cases where signals are used to implement something else. They should not be defined as signals but messages.
Start Message (implemented as signal)
Boundary events (messages BoundaryEventHandler)
catching events (messages)
this should be removed.
In spite they are implemented as signal you need to make a difference in objects there.
emitters can be used in spring boot envioronment. plz remove this.
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -29,6 +29,7 @@
     <dependency>
       <groupId>org.apache.kafka</groupId>
       <artifactId>kafka-clients</artifactId>
+      <scope>provided</scope>

nodes.bodyText: this is redundant as we have the signal object here already.

This objects are coming from bpm2 parser. They should not be here.
you have an object already for this SignalDesc.
I dont see the counter part MessageDesc
it is not signal metadata... it is the signal element it self. change for a more descriptive name. i.e signallement or signalobject.
same as before. change to a more descriptive name. this is not the metadata but  the element itself.

this should not be here. create a dependency with the parser.
try to put this logic in ServicesProcessDataEventListener
there is no signal type only id, name and structure ref.

+
+import java.io.Serializable;
+
+public interface SignalDesc extends Serializable {
+
+    String getId();
+
+    String getName();
+
+    String getStructureRef();
+
+    SignalType getSignalType();

nodes.bodyText:
this should not be here. create a dependency with the parser.
try to put this logic in ServicesProcessDataEventListener
not required.

nodes.bodyText: Kafka dependency (as part of kafka consumer extension) will be available also in Sprinboot (when incorporated) so, in order to keep "consistency" with ES emitter (where dependencies with external libraries that are included in kie-server, like Apache connection)  I changed this to provided

       <groupId>org.apache.kafka</groupId>
       <artifactId>kafka-clients</artifactId>
+      <scope>provided</scope>

nodes.bodyText: messagesDesc should be also added to the output.

                 ", forms=" + forms +
                 ", roles=" + roles +
                 ", signals=" + signals +
+                ", signalsDesc=" + signalsDesc +

+package org.jbpm.kie.services.impl.model;
+
+import org.jbpm.bpmn2.core.Message;
+import org.jbpm.services.api.model.MessageDesc;
+
+public class MessageDescImpl extends SignalDescBaseImpl implements MessageDesc {
+
+    private static final long serialVersionUID = 1L;
+
+    public static MessageDescImpl from(Message messasge) {
